page.content: {8:}Notice the large amount of IVY on TREES in the wood. Although Foresters claim it damages and even kills host trees it is not a parasite. The main damage is caused by its weight and resistance to wind whilst the shade from its leaves reduces{ {photosynthesis.} {9:}These DOUGLAS FIR are over 80 years old and are named after{David {Douglas}who introduced the seed in 1827. When crushed the needles smell strongly of turpentine. The straight timber was useful for ships' masts. { 10:}On this slope are LARCH which is our only common decidous conifer and REDWOODS which can grow to 100 metres in their native California. { 11:}The VICTORIAN IRON FENCE to the right marks the old estate boundary which the tail continues onto BLACK HEATH.
